title: Taylor Swift and KPop Stars Rule Music in 2025
summary: In 2025, Taylor Swift and KPop stars were the biggest music hits. Taylor Swift's album 'The Life of a Showgirl' sold the most copies worldwide. Rosé from Blackpink had the top song 'APT' with Bruno Mars, which got over two billion streams. This song has some Korean words and is the first non-English song to be number one globally. Another KPop group, Huntr/x, had the second biggest song 'Golden'. The IFPI, a music group, made these charts. Many songs in the top 10 were from earlier years, and no British artists were in the top 10. This shows how popular KPop and Taylor Swift are around the world.

background_read: Music charts show which songs and albums are most popular each year. In 2025, Taylor Swift and KPop stars like Rosé and Huntr/x did very well. KPop is music from South Korea that many people enjoy worldwide. The IFPI is an organization that collects data on music sales and streams to create these charts. This year was special because a song with Korean words became the top global hit for the first time.
Article_Structure: WHO: Taylor Swift, Rosé from Blackpink, Huntr/x, and other singers like Bruno Mars.
WHAT: Taylor Swift had the top album, and Rosé had the top song 'APT' with over two billion streams.
WHERE: This happened globally, meaning all around the world.
WHY: It shows that KPop and Taylor Swift are very popular and breaking records in music.
